title: Mathematics Education Innovation Project Utilizing Blended Learning (Large-Scale)

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of elementary and secondary mathematics fundamentals
context.additional_context: Practical project-based learning to address post-pandemic mathematics education changes. Learner-centered class design utilizing collaboration tools and personal devices in blended (online/offline) environments

learning_goals: Learners can effectively utilize digital collaboration tools (online whiteboards, real-time document editing, etc.) for solving mathematical problems in a blended learning environment.
Learners can reinterpret real-life problems through mathematical modeling and propose solutions using a PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.
Learners can diagnose their learning gaps through formative assessments and revise their learning strategies by synthesizing online/offline feedback.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)
Open-Source Software for Mathematics Education (e.g., GeoGebra)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
